TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Scene extends Urho.Node

Docs.summary: Root scene node, represents the whole scene.

remarks.para: When you create a Scene, it is automatically attached to the specified context (or the default as exposed by . The Scene is just the toplevel and it holds the various nodes for your application.

In general, you will want to add an Octree component to your scene, without it, none of the visual components will be shown. The default Octree component volume goes from (-1000,-1000,-1000) to (1000,1000,1000) in world coordinates.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: Preserve

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Scene which is tied to the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: Preserve

Docs.param: Pointer to the raw unmanaged Urho object.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Scene, given a raw pointer to an unmanaged object

remarks.para: This creates a new managed wrapper for the type using the raw pointer to an unmanaged object.
Objects that are created in this fashion get registered with the UrhoSharp runtime.
This is intended to be used by the UrhoSharp runtime, and is not intended to be used by users.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Urho.Context context) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: Preserve

Docs.param: The context that this object will be attached to.

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Scene linked to a specific .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: Preserve

Docs.summary: Empty constructor, chain to this constructor when you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.

remarks.para: This constructor should be invoked by your code if you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.
This essentially circumvents the default path that creates a new object and sets the handle and does not call RegisterObject on the target, you must do this on your own constructor.
You would typically chain to this constructor from your own, and then set the handle to the unmanaged object from your code, and then register your object.

remarks.para: The event can register multiple callbacks and invoke all of them. If this is not desired, and you only need a single shot callback, you can use the method. That one will force that callback and will ignore any previously set events here.

Docs.summary: Return whether an asynchronous loading operation is in progress.
Return maximum milliseconds per frame to spend on async loading. Or Set maximum milliseconds per frame to spend on async scene loading.
Return the load mode of the current asynchronous loading operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DelayedMarkedDirty(class Urho.Component component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Add a component to the delayed dirty notify queue. Is thread-safe.
Return elapsed time in seconds. Or Set elapsed time in seconds. This can be used to prevent inaccuracy in the timer if the scene runs for a long time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void EndThreadedUpdate() cil managed

Docs.summary: End a threaded update. Notify components that marked themselves for delayed dirty processing.
Return source file name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Subscription SubscribeToAsyncLoadFinished(class System.Action`1<valuetype Urho.AsyncLoadFinishedEventArgs> handler) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("SubscribeTo API may lead to unxpected behaviour and will be removed in a future version. Use C# event '.AsyncLoadFinished += ...' instead.")

Docs.param: The handler to invoke when this event is raised.
Docs.summary: Subscribes to the AsyncLoadFinished event raised by the Scene.
Docs.returns: Returns an Urho.Subscription that can be used to cancel the subscription.

remarks.para: This method will override any prior subscription, including those assigned to on event handlers.
This has the advantage that it does a straight connection and returns a handle that is easy to unsubscribe from.
For a more event-like approach, use the event.

Docs.param: The handler to invoke when this event is raised.
Docs.summary: Subscribes to the SceneSubsystemUpdate event raised by the Scene.
Docs.returns: Returns an Urho.Subscription that can be used to cancel the subscription.

remarks.para: This method will override any prior subscription, including those assigned to on event handlers.
This has the advantage that it does a straight connection and returns a handle that is easy to unsubscribe from.
For a more event-like approach, use the event.

Docs.summary: Return threaded update flag.
Return update time scale. Or Set update time scale. 1.0 = real time (default.)
Urho's type system type.
Docs.value: StringHash representing the type for this C# type.
Docs.remarks: This returns the Urho's type and is surfaced for low-level Urho code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Update(float32 timeStep) cil managed

Docs.summary: Update scene. Called by HandleUpdate.
Controls whether updates to the scene are enabled or disabled.
To be added.

remarks.para: The event can register multiple callbacks and invoke all of them. If this is not desired, and you only need a single shot callback, you can use the method. That one will force that callback and will ignore any previously set events here.

Docs.summary: Return node user variable reverse mappings.
